About me

For a start, my favourite quote is,
Do what you love, love what you do.

Hi again, my name is Anudit Verma, I am an avid open source enthusiast, contributor, and developer hailing from New Delhi, India.

I obtained my Bachelor of Technology degree in Computer Science & Engineering (CSE) from University School of Information, Communication, and Technology (USICT) in New Delhi, India.

I am a programmer, software developer, and a seasoned ethical hacker, participating in various global hackathons.

I enjoy reading books. In 2018, with an average of 1 book per week, I completed a Reading Challenge for reading 51 books. A list of those amazing books can be found here. Make sure to add some of them in your 2019 reading list.

Also, I am very fond of video games, I love to create digital art and play around with my Photoshop skills, apart from these I love listening to music and occasional cooking. I am eager to meet new people, to connect, discuss, network and grow, mostly at software developers’ conferences, dev-fests, and gaming meet-ups.

Let’s connect if you want to collab and create something awesome in the world of open source tech. Follow the social media links given below or drop a mail here.

Follow @anuditverma

Oh, and one more thing, if you are wondering about the meaning of my name, well...


Yes! It literally means translated, interesting, right?
